paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a TTR gene variant associated with euthyroid hyperthyroxinemia, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: 3 generations of a family, specific ages not mentioned

individual_records.phenotype_details: elevated total T4 concentrations, clinically euthyroid
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Although five of eight individuals had elevated total T4 concentrations, all affected individuals were clinically euthyroid and all had normal free T4 levels.

functional_data.summary: Purified TTR from the propositus had an affinity for 125I-T4 three times that of control TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with the phenotype in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was confirmed by amino acid sequencing of tryptic peptides derived from purified plasma TTR.
key_quotes: In 50% of clones amplified from exon 4, a substitution of adenine (ACC) for guanine (GCC) in codon 109 resulted in the replacement of threonine-for-alanine.
The adenine-for-guanine substitution abolishes one of two Fnu 4H I restriction sites in exon 4.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
